result.execSummary:
The defendant Britney J. Quade was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Walmart in Wausau
To be paid within 4 months.
Maintain GFE in fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two and when not fully engaged complete 5 hours community service per week.
No contact with C.B.-Q. or Walmart in Wausau.

Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent.
Letters of apology to victims.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: With huber for work, work search, and treatment if defendant qualifies.

Defendant makes statement
COURT makes findings
COURT ORDERS: Ct. 1 (Theft-Movable Property <=$2500- repeater): Serve 9 months MCJ. Credit granted for 78 days. Jail may be with huber release for work, treatment, or medical care for doctor appointments if meets jail criteria. Any outstanding fees $400.00 are coverted into civil judgment. 
Atty Bliss asks court for furlough request for medical care and delivery of child
COURT denies furlough request for medical care and to deliver child; Atty Bliss may provide extra medical documentation to court regarding pregnancy.

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 2:06pm
INCLUDES 15CM2004 & 15CM2261
State appears by ADA Ralph Uttke.  Defendant appears in person, in custody, with Atty John Bliss.

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
15CM2261:
Ct. 1 Retail Theft - intentionally take (<=$500)- repeater >> D&RI
COURT grants above

PLEA: 
15CM2004:
Ct. 1 Theft-Movable Property <=$2500- repeater >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: w/hold sentencing. 1 year probation. CONDITIONS: Serve 30 days conditional jail, begins today with zero days credit. Huber release for work, work search, treatment if meets jail criteria. Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. No contact with victims- C.B-Q. or Walmart in Wausau. Write letters of apology to C. B-Q. and Walmart in Wausau. Pay back restitution of $82.70 to Walmart in Wausau, to be paid within first 4 months. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two, when not fully engaged complete 5 hours of community service per week (and have 3 verifiable job contacts, per week). Complete 30 hours of community service. Pay CC. Pay DNA sample and surcharge. Zero days credit if revoked.

Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
